summary: Stop making everything Daenerys does about Jon
body:
Stop making everything Daenerys does about Jon

And most importantly, stop reducing her to someone Jon is going to put a baby into. She’s not an incubator.

summary: And he isn’t mentioned Jon as a Stark 👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽Starks final will disappointing us 🧐🧐🧐They Are Brother and sister but not Family....
body:
Isaac Hempstd Wright isn’t thinking that Starks can be Family again!

“No way. There’s no way the Starks can just go back to being a family again. They’re all just such different characters now. I mean, they were different to begin with, but still brothers and sisters. Now, Arya’s an assassin. Bran’s a tree wizard. And Sansa’s this conniving political mistress. So putting them back together again… I think it would just end up being disappointing. That’s why I don’t think it should happen—because people would go, ‘Oh. Oh no.’”

And he isn’t mentioned Jon as a Stark 👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽Starks final will disappointing us 🧐🧐🧐They Are Brother and sister but not Family. Jon will travel to the south with Dany as Targaryen. Probably Arya Travels with them and became queensguard as she always dreamed. Sansa will die or stay alone in North.

summary: so many vows. they make you swear and swear. defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the...
caption: so many vows. they make you swear and swear. defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. but what if your father despises the king? what if the king massacres the innocent? it’s too much. no matter what you do, you’re forsaking one vow or another.

reblog.comment: so many vows. they make you swear and swear. defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. but what if your father despises the king? what if the king massacres the innocent? it’s too much. no matter what you do, you’re forsaking one vow or another.

trail.content_raw: so many vows. they make you swear and swear. defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. but what if your father despises the king? what if the king massacres the innocent? it’s too much. no matter what you do, you’re forsaking one vow or another.
trail.content: so many vows. they make you swear and swear. defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. but what if your father despises the king? what if the king massacres the innocent? it’s too much. no matter what you do, you’re forsaking one vow or another.

blog.name: evenne2011
blog.title: hula hoops make me happy
blog.description: moments of happiness in a bleak world

body:
Aegon III/Jon Snow Parallels

There’s a bunch. I’m gonna throw a few in here and let you add to it if you want.

-Orphaned Targ Prince

-Mother was killed in front of them by a dragon (Jon himself being the dragon in this case)

-Father dies in single combat against a relative.

-Crowned after brutal civil war and in the middle of a long winter.

-Has two “half sisters” who become close advisors. One is more courtly and charming (and tied to the Vale) while the other is more of a fighter and aggressive. Both are equally badass.

-First “love” dies brutally.

-Winds up marrying a woman of Valyrian descent whose name start with the “Daen-“ prefix.

-And, my favorite, has a Stark as hand for a little while who wants to bring him to Winterfell to marry a Stark daughter and it’s called by the maester who wrote the book an “obvious falsehood”. Lol enjoy that Jonsa’s.

blog.name: chitowngirl-12
blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: Burning people alive is bad regardless of who does it
There isn't a platinum blonde with ridiculous titles exception when it comes to morality
Jon comes off as a docile servant in Season 7 who refuses to stand up for his values his people or his family
summary: If Jon was somehow OK with dany burning and crucifying people or feeding men to her dragons or killing people as young as 13...
question: If Jon was somehow OK with dany burning and crucifying people or feeding men to her dragons or killing people as young as 13 just because of their clothes then I would fully expect Mel to give both Jon and davos the riot act about how hypocritical they are.  Because if Mel is banished for burning innocents (as she should be) than dany should also be banished.  I bet Mel planned their meeting so that she can come back north safely and with a smug look of satisfaction.
answer:
I agree with your comment, but I don’t think the showrunners see the hypocrisy.  The show has been very hit or miss about showing consequences for burning people alive.  Princess Fluffy gets spared any punishment for her poor and immoral decisions in general.  Burning people alive, i.e. the Tarlys, is just one of them.  The one red flag for me is the fact that Jon doesn’t challenge her on this or on her bad behavior in general.  She is holding him prisoner, goes around regularly threatening to burn people and cities, and finally does it, but he doesn’t say a peep.  The writers certainly have turned him into a submissive pawn.  I bet he spends Season 8 walking two steps behind her and mumbling “Yes Your Grace” to her.

And if Jon is going to excuse Dany’s behavior because he needs her dragons, then he should also forgive Melisandre.  She seems like a valuable person to have around to fight the supernatural ice zombies.  If the show is arguing in favor of utilitarian ethics, then Melisandre’s speech to Jon in Season 6 was very persuasive.  But I don’t think that the show sees it like this.  There is just a huge double standard when it comes to Fluffy.  In fact, the rumors/ theories I’ve heard regarding Tyrion in Season 8 are going to anger lots of fans if they turn out to be true.

blog.name: coolkarmact
blog.title: The Comedian
blog.description: In the end, we're all satisfied. And you're set free.

text:
We are not now that strength which in old days
Moved earth and heaven, that which we are, we are;
One equal temper of heroic hearts,
Made weak by time and fate, but strong in will
To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield.
source:
Ulysses, by Alfred Lord Tennyson

I am re-watching Skyfall and the scene where the last few lines of Ulysses are being recited by M gives some strong Stark siblings vibes.

Also, the title track of Skyfall would make for a great trailer song for GOT season 8!
